tool.name: ScriptManager: Filter Pip Seq
tool.command:
ln -s "$input1" "temp_input1.fasta" && ln -s "$input2" "temp_input2.bam" &&
samtools faidx "temp_input1.fasta" && samtools index "temp_input2.bam" &&
java -jar $__tool_directory__/ScriptManager-v0.14.jar bam-manipulation filter-pip-seq
#if str($output_file_name.bool) == "Yes" : -o "$output_file_name.file_name" #end if
#if str($nucleotide) != "T" : -f "$nucleotide" #end if
"temp_input1.fasta" "temp_input2.bam"
tool.help: **What it does** Filter BAM file by -1 nucleotide. Requires genome FASTA file. Note this program does not index the resulting BAM file and user must use appropriate samtools command to generate BAI.
